jobs.description:
Company Description

ATPCO is the foundation of flight shopping, providing pricing and retailing data, tools, and services to 500+ airlines, global distribution systems, sales channels, and technology companies. In addition, ATPCO links the entire airline community together, collaborating to develop industry standards for airline distribution and end-to-end technology solutions. As a result, ATPCO solutions work seamlessly across existing, new, and evolving technologies and methods from shopping to settlement. Airline-owned and reliably supporting air travel for more than 55 years, ATPCO is everywhere people buy flights.

We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, protected military/veteran status, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, or any other legally protected factor.



Job Description

As a Product Owner, you report to the Product Manager and lead execution of business delivery of product enhancements. Your focus is to develop a deep understanding of your product and its capabilities. This role is responsible for working with the product, engaging with customers and colleagues, and staying abreast of industry trends. Your product is your passion. 

In this role, you will work closely with designers, business analysts, quality analysts, and developers to solve specific customer problems outlined by the Product Manager. Your primary tools are personas, stories, and backlogs, focusing on what features will address selected business problems planned for future releases. 

This role is within ATPCO’s Create The Offer portfolio, which focuses on allowing airlines and their technology providers to most effectively create the offers, price points, and conditions associated with tickets and ancillary purchases. The products you will primarily work on in this portfolio are in growth mode with agile teams that are focused on high velocity product delivery.  

This role will be focused on innovation and out-of-the-box features in our existing products, and new products that support our customers and users on the path to dynamic offer creation. 

Key Responsibilities: 

1. Vision and Goal-Setting: Lay out the vision and goals for the project feature within the overall product development team. Define the target audience for the solution and inspire the team with real stories about real people to help them grasp the vision and goals. 

2. Collaboration and Inspiration: Act as the voice of the customer, representing their needs to the product development team. Collaborate effectively with business analysts, designers, quality, and engineering team members, using real-life examples to drive home the product's vision and persona goals. 

3. Backlog Management and Prioritization: Manage the product backlog diligently. Prioritize deliverables, continually manage the list of stories, and provide context and business value to the team. Clarify success criteria and define specific results for the acceptance of deliverables. 

4. Requirements and Roadmap Development: Assist in requirements definition, adjustments, and clarifications. Help define success criteria. With direction from the Product Manager, create and maintain a feature roadmap that enables a practical delivery approach, solving identified business problems and sequencing the stories for delivery. 

5. Reporting and Monitoring: Monitor and report on the project development status. Keep track of metrics like the number of prioritized items pending, work in progress, items completed pending acceptance, and items accepted. 

6. Customer and Market Expertise: Support the team with product and market expertise, ensuring every team member understands the customer perspective and the market dynamics. 

7. Collaborative Business Focus: While maintaining a business-centric focus, interact with technology stakeholders when necessary, ensuring that technology initiatives align with business requests and product enhancements. 

8. Data Analysis: You back up your roadmap and product decisions by looking at product usage data. Using your technical skillset, you implement systems, logging, and dashboards to report on feature adoption. 

Skills and Competencies: 

- Strong skills in creating and using personas, stories, and backlogs as primary tools for expressing customer needs and product features. 

- Ability to inspire and collaborate with a diverse team, driving them towards a shared vision. 

- Excellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex ideas effectively to various stakeholders. 

- Adept at prioritizing tasks and managing a product backlog to align with business goals. 

- Proficient in monitoring and reporting project progress, with an eye for detail and a commitment to excellence. 

 

As a Product Owner on our team, you will be pivotal in bridging the gap between customer needs and the technical execution of our product roadmap, all while maintaining a keen focus on solving real business problems. Your role is crucial in ensuring that our product not only meets but exceeds the expectations of our customers and stakeholders. 

The Ideal Candidate: 

  • At least 2 years of experience with Data analysis 

  • At least 2 years of experience working with ATPCO subscription data 

  • Familiarity with New Distribution Capability, Dynamic Offers, and Web Fare data 

  • Experience with product management 

  • Experience with writing and communication of business requirements 

  • Experience creating wireframes and mockups 

  • Experience working with API products 

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel 

  • Proficiency with SQL 

  • Understanding of basic SaaS business metrics 

Salary Range: $112,950–$160,400

You will be responsible for building scalable solutions that enhance employer engagement, improve client reporting, and optimize internal tools to better support our partners. If you're passionate about data-driven decision-making, growth, and creating seamless employer experiences, this role is for you!

What you will do:

  • Develop and execute the product strategy for employer engagement mechanisms, including challenges, marketing automation, and branded experiences.
  • Own and enhance Headspace’s B2B client reporting capabilities, ensuring robust, scalable, and insightful data reporting for our partners while collaborating with the Client Reporting team on strategic partner needs.

  • Support B2B2C operations and escalations, working closely with cross-functional teams to streamline issue resolution and optimize the user experience.

  • Develop product requirements, define success metrics, and ensure seamless execution of the B2B roadmap.
  • Act as a primary escalation point for B2B and partner-related product issues, coordinating responses and long-term improvements.

What you will bring:

Required Skills:

  • Product Experience: Minimum of 2 years of product management experience, defining product requirements, success metrics, working with engineering teams, & iterating products over time. 
  • Data Proficiency: Strong understanding of data structures, reporting tools, and analytics methodologies to drive product insights and decision-making.
  • B2B Product Experience: Familiarity with employer engagement strategies, partner marketing, and enterprise SaaS models.
  • Growth & Optimization Expertise: Experience optimizing digital engagement, automation, and reporting tools to increase product adoption and partner success.
  • Project Management: Ability to manage cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholders, ensuring alignment and timely execution.
  • Technical Acumen: Understanding of software development processes and ability to work closely with engineering teams.
  • Stakeholder Management: Strong collaboration skills with internal teams (sales, customer success, engineering, marketing) to drive alignment and execution.
  • Problem Solving: Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity while delivering practical, scalable solutions.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience working with enterprise clients, especially in the health and wellness or HR tech space.
  • Familiarity with business intelligence and analytics platforms (e.g., Looker, Tableau, DataBricks, Amplitude).
  • Experience with marketing automation tools and customer engagement platforms.
  • Knowledge of employer benefits ecosystems and how digital health solutions fit within them.
  • Background in SaaS, B2B2C, or marketplace models.

Pay & Benefits:

The base salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to skills and scope required, relevant licensure and certifications, and unique relevant experience and job-related skills. The base salary range for this role is $107,123-$133,903.

Paid performance incentives are also included for those in eligible roles. Additional details about our Total Rewards package will be provided during the recruitment process.

jobs.title: Senior Product Strategist
jobs.description:
Introduction:

Very Good Ventures is a global consultancy that delivers clients elegant solutions using disruptive technologies. At VGV, we believe that building very good technology starts with a culture of excellence, collaboration, humility, and openness – and of course, have a very good time while doing it.  We place our company values and culture at the forefront of everything we do. 

Rising to prominence as the foremost Flutter experts, VGV is at an exciting stage of growth as we expand our global presence and our range of strategic services. Our mission is to lead the most influential companies through new digital frontiers and improve the relationship between technology and those that create, manage, and experience it. VGV’s client roster spans industries, including Toyota, Google, Dow Jones, JSX, Betterment, and Norwegian Cruise Lines. 

People come to work at VGV to solve challenging problems with the newest technology, alongside some of the best talent in the industry, and in a culture that remains steadfastly dedicated to its employees.

Position Overview:

VGV is at an exciting time in its evolution, as it expands beyond “just a Flutter shop” and into a full-scale digital consultancy. As the Senior Product Strategist, you’ll have the opportunity to be a critical part in leading this journey, by both delivering digital product strategy engagements and founding a new strategy consulting offering. 

As the Senior Product Strategist, you will initially focus on delivering strategy engagements for clients, guiding them through the process of evaluating both the problem and solution spaces. You’ll collaborate with researchers to identify unmet user needs, partner with designers to ideate and prototype, and paint future-state visions of potential client solutions. As the team grows, this role will evolve more into a leadership-focused position, where you’ll be responsible for building and leading a world-class strategy team. You will also collaborate with our Business Development team to bring our strategy services to market, pitch to potential clients, and drive growth for this offering.

Key Responsibilities:

  • GTM Strategy and Service Evolution: Partner with the CSO and Business Development team to craft go-to-market (GTM) messages for our new strategy consulting service. Shape the evolution of our strategy offerings, refining processes and methodologies that focus on desired outcomes for prospects.
  • Creative and Generative Thinking: Team with researchers to uncover and prioritize unmet user needs. Ensure that insights are deeply informed by user research and analytics to shape effective product strategies.
  • Evaluative Thinking: Create future-state visions for clients, prioritizing concepts based on three lenses: user desirability, business viability, and implementation complexity.
  • Designer Partnership: Collaborate closely with designers to ideate, prototype, and rapidly evaluate the potential value of concepts. Ensure alignment between strategic goals and creative output.
  • Articulate Business Value: Translate solutions into clear business value, partnering with client stakeholders to define return on investment (ROI) when applicable. Help clients understand how strategy aligns with broader business objectives.
  • Understand Engineering Complexity: Work closely with engineers and solution architects to assess the feasibility of potential solutions. Ensure that proposed solutions can be realistically built and delivered within the client’s technical constraints and timelines.
  • Value-Driven Roadmaps: Develop comprehensive product roadmaps that define Minimum Viable Products (MVP) and phased releases, setting clear priorities and timelines.
  • Client Elicitation and Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their business needs, identifying new opportunities, and ensuring satisfaction throughout the engagement lifecycle. Lead client ideation exercises and driving creative problem solving
  • Strategy as an Account Expansion Tactic: Create compelling strategies for key accounts as an account expansion exercise. Partner with delivery teams to understand the current client ecosystem so that you can excite clients about what they could build next. 
  • Vision-casting and Storytelling for Persuasion: Craft and communicate compelling future-state digital visions for clients, using storytelling to create excitement and align stakeholders on the vision for their digital transformation. Strong public speaker capable of ‘owning the room’ from leading presentations to facilitating healthy group discussion
  • Thought Leadership: Represent our agency in industry events, webinars, and publications, establishing our voice and authority in the digital product strategy space.

Requirements:

  • 4 to 6+ years of experience in digital product strategy, including hands-on project delivery and leadership.
  • Proven track record of delivering successful strategy engagements for clients, ideally in an agency or consultancy environment.
  • Experience leading teams through the entire product development lifecycle, from discovery to delivery.
  • Deep understanding of multi-platform solutions, particularly Flutter, and how they can be leveraged to achieve client goals.
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for identifying opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
  • Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally with designers, researchers, engineers, and business stakeholders.
  • Passion for building and mentoring teams, with the ability to inspire and guide others to achieve their best work.
  • Strong storytelling skills, with the ability to persuade and inspire clients around future-state digital visions.
  • Familiarity with the technical constraints of software development and an ability to partner with engineers to assess feasibility.

Bonus Points:

  • Master’s degree in Business Administration (MBA) or a related field.
  • Experience in consulting beyond product-focused solutions, with exposure to broader business management practices.
  • Proven ability to clearly articulate and measure the business impact of strategic ideas and recommendations.
  • Familiarity with marketing strategy and customer segmentation to align digital products with target audiences.
  • Expertise in scenario planning to help clients prepare for various business and market outcomes.
  • Experience designing and facilitating innovation incubators to drive forward-thinking solutions.
  • Proficiency in design thinking methodologies, with a strong consulting background in applying these processes to solve complex business challenges.
  • Experience in leading digital transformation initiatives and creating comprehensive roadmaps for organizations.
  • A talent for building and maintaining strong, long-term relationships with client stakeholders at all levels.
  • Advanced skills in presentation software such as Keynote or Google Slides, capable of crafting visually engaging and persuasive presentations.
Company Values
  • Do our best, professional work.
  • Be collaborative partners.
  • Scale with standards.
  • Always be growing.
  • Be very good.

Very Good Ventures is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds. We are committed to providing a fair and inclusive work environment, free from discrimination and harassment, and promoting diversity in our workforce. We value and celebrate the unique perspectives and contributions of each member of our global workforce, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected characteristic. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is essential to our success as a company.

⚡ About PowerUs

PowerUs is building the ultimate career platform for skilled blue-collar workers, helping them find jobs they love and supporting their professional growth—from apprenticeship to retirement.

As a two-way marketplace, we connect skilled workers with companies that need their expertise. We empower workers to transition into high-demand industries, such as renewable energy, where they can increase their earnings by up to 50%. At the same time, we help companies quickly hire the skilled talent they need, bridging a critical gap in the shift toward a sustainable energy future.

With €24 million raised in our Series B financing, we’re dedicated to making skilled blue-collar work attractive, and driving a more sustainable future.

🙌  Job Mission

As the Product Manager in the Marketplace Squad, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of the PowerUs marketplace and the recommendation system that brings workers and companies together. You'll collaborate with data scientists, engineers and designers to improve ranking and recommendation algorithms, ensuring our matching experience creates success for both workers and companies.

This role will focus heavily on logic-driven and recommendation-based marketplace improvements, requiring someone who can step in and drive the conversation, collaborate cross-functionally, and translate complex technical topics into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders across the business.

🎯 What You’ll Do

  • Own and drive the vision, strategy, and execution of the Marketplace recommendation algorithm and matching experience that underpins our job marketplace.

  • Collaborate closely with data scientists, engineers, designers, and business stakeholders to deliver results for workers, companies, and the business.

  • Develop and communicate a clear product roadmap for marketplace matching and recommendations, balancing short-term impact with long-term strategic goals.

  • Identify, capture, and leverage user behavior signals (e.g., explicit preferences, engagement data) to refine and personalize job recommendations.

  • Ensure the UI effectively communicates recommendation logic to users, providing transparency and clarity in the job search experience.

🌟 What We’re Looking For

  • 3 - 8 years of experience working on data-intensive marketplace products, focusing on recommendation systems, personalization, ranking, or search to optimize matching and engagement.

  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and methodologies with a structured and analytical approach to problem-solving.

  • Deep understanding of A/B testing, including when to experiment, test setup, and results interpretation for ranking systems and model testing.

  • Ability to translate complex technical concepts (such as ML-based ranking models) into clear, non-technical insights for business stakeholders.

  • Experience working in both startup and larger company environments is a plus - balancing the ability to move fast in an ambiguous, resource-constrained setting while bringing best practices from larger-scale environments.

  • Discounts for Urban Sports Club or WellHub to keep you active and healthy (for employees based in Germany).

  • The opportunity to join an early-stage, fast-growing startup backed by Tier-1 investors.

  • The chance to make a significant impact on company strategy from day one and collaborate directly with the founders.

As an equal opportunity employer, we proudly welcome applications from people of all races, ethnicities, disability statuses, ages, religions, gender identities, and sexual orientations. We encourage you to apply even if you don't think you meet all of the criteria above but are still interested in the role and our mission. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for team members who are genuinely excited to join PowerUs! We look forward to receiving your application!

About Lendable

Lendable is on a mission to make consumer finance amazing: faster, cheaper, and friendlier. We're building one of the world’s leading fintech companies and are off to a strong start:

  • One of the UK’s newest unicorns with a team of just over 500 people

  • Among the fastest-growing tech companies in the UK

  • Profitable since 2017

  • Backed by top investors including Balderton Capital and Goldman Sachs

  • Loved by customers with the best reviews in the market (4.9 across 10,000s of reviews on Trustpilot)

So far, we’ve rebuilt the Big Three consumer finance products from scratch: loans, credit cards and car finance. We get money into our customers’ hands in minutes instead of days.

We’re growing fast, and there’s a lot more to do: we’re going after the two biggest Western markets (UK and US) where trillions worth of financial products are held by big banks with dated systems and painful processes.

Join us if you want to

  1. Take ownership across a broad remit. You are trusted to make decisions that drive a material impact on the direction and success of Lendable from day 1

  2. Work in small teams of exceptional people, who are relentlessly resourceful to solve problems and find smarter solutions than the status quo

  3. Build the best technology in-house, using new data sources, machine learning and AI to make machines do the heavy lifting

The opportunity

Lendable is revolutionising the credit card industry by making financial tools accessible, intuitive, and empowering.

Zable is a Mobile-App first credit card that empowers customers to build their credit score while meeting their spending needs sustainably. We are looking for an exceptional product leader to help us scale the product exponentially.

You will report directly to our CPTO and partner with our Cards MD to: co-lead a cross-functional team of Product Managers & Engineers, define the product vision, set quarterly OKRs, and drive execution against the roadmap.

The role will cover all aspects of credit card product management, including:

  • Acquiring customers in an efficient and differentiated way

  • Improving our underwriting and fraud prevention capabilities to support best-in-class credit decisions

  • Building tools and leveraging AI to maximise efficiency for our Operations teams

  • Helping our customers build good repayment habits and supporting them when times get tough

  • Shaping Mobile App experience to drive activation, spend, and engagement

  • Scaling our in-house technology platform to support the rapidly growing customer base

We have some of the best engineers in the industry and we need you to help us showcase their talent to the world.

Your Impact

  • Drive the Product Vision & Roadmap

    Develop and articulate a clear, compelling product strategy & roadmap for our credit card product and motivate a large multi-disciplinary team to deliver against strategic goals. You will partner with Credit, Operations, Growth, Data Science, Legal, Compliance, and other Product teams to drive cross-functional alignment and move projects forward.

  • Build & Mentor High-Performing Teams

    Lead a team of high-calibre Product Managers, each leading their own Engineering pods and owning elements of the product. Inspire and build a culture where people seamlessly collaborate across functions, challenge the status quo, and consistently deliver best-in-class, customer-first solutions. Consistently provide clear, actionable feedback that empowers your team to grow and exceed expectations.

  • Drive Data-Backed Decisions

    Utilise your exceptional numerical and analytical skills - leveraging analytical tools where needed (SQL/Python/Superset) - to measure the impact of new features, champion the use of A/B and multivariate experimentation and translate complex data sets into actionable insights. You understand the value of using both qualitative and quantitative data to inform strategic investments and prioritise the backlog. You will champion the integration of AI into both product strategy and the day-to-day operations of the team. 

  • Outcome Focus

    You are relentlessly outcome-focused and have strong commercial acumen - setting clear, measurable goals and driving initiatives that deliver tangible impact for customers. You expertly navigate complex trade-offs, balancing short-term wins with sustainable growth. You’re able to make tough decisions - especially when faced with high ambiguity. You own these decisions but also course correct when needed. You don’t have a massive ego and you are happy to listen and change your mind when presented with a good argument.

  • Lead by Example

    You are a hands-on leader - never shying away from the trenches. You actively roll up your sleeves and immerse yourself in the intricate details, working side by side with your team to tackle complex challenges head-on. You are happy to take on responsibility for implementation and design decisions and enjoy a healthy dose of pressure. A willingness to investigate and solve even the smallest of customer problems is a must.

Your experience

  • 8+ years of experience in a Strategy, Product, or Analytics role

  • 3+ years of experience in consumer lending, ideally credit cards

  • 3+ years of experience leading a high-performing team

Interview process

  • A quick introduction call with someone from the Talent Team

  • A take-home exercise designed to showcase your analytical and strategic thinking (with a debrief via video)

  • Final round interviews with our CPTO, Cards MD, and key Product and Engineering leads

Life at Lendable

  • Best-in-class compensation, including equity.

  • You can work from home every Monday and Friday if you wish - on the other days, we all come together IRL to be together, build and exchange ideas.

  • Enjoy a fully stocked kitchen with everything you need to whip up breakfast, lunch, snacks, and drinks in the office every Tuesday-Thursday.

  • We're an equal-opportunity employer and are looking to make Lendable the most inclusive and open workspace in London
